Notes: Also the curriculum used in Yukon Territory, with some adaptations for the Yukon context

Name: Quebec Education Program
Notes: Is in both English and French - French-only curriculum offerings are noted as such

Name: Nunavut Curriculum and Resources K-12
Notes: Includes an overview/explanation of the four 'strands' of curriculum, as well as an exhaustive list of all programs of study from K-12
As mentioned, adapts BC curriculum - this page highlights the additions and alterations made locally

Name: Dutch School Curriculum
Notes: Collaboration between the varios municipal governments and the Dutch Ministry of Education, Culture and Science. However, it is generally a universal curriculum which everyone follows until secondary school
Range goes from 'Year' 1-13, with year 1 being age 5, to year 13 being age 17/18
New Zealand curriculum is bilingual in English & Maori - the English portion is included here
While this is the program for public primary/secondary schools, private schools do not need to adhere to it.
However, certain equivalencies must be met.

Schools develop tailored local curricula that meet the needs of their students either directly from the Australian Curriculum, in some states and territories, or from curriculum documents incorporating the Australian Curriculum. There is no official Australian Homeschool Curriculum
